disables.description: List of NTP to be disabled.

disable.description: Configure the NTP service. The 'get' operation is performed to query the disabling status of the NTP service. The 'create' and 'merge' operations are performed to disable the NTP service. The 'delete' operation is performed to enable the NTP service.

ip-address.description: IP address of the remote peer. The IP address must be a host address and cannot be the loopback, broadcast, multicast, or reference clock address.

type.description: Indicates a peer or a server configuration.

vpn-name.description: Name of a VPN instance. If the entered IP address is an IPv4 address, first enable the IPv4 address family of the VPN instance. If the entered IP address is an IPv6 address, first enable the IPv6 address family of the VPN instance.

is-preferred.description: Enable/disable the peer or server as a preferred source.

ifname.description: Interface name to be used for communicating with the server/peer.

key-id.description: Specifies the key number used when transmitting messages to the remote peer.

max-poll-interval.description: Maximum polling interval at which packets are sent. The units is second as power of 2.

min-poll-interval.description: Minimum polling interval at which packets are sent. The units is second as power of 2.

is-preempt.description: Enable/disable the peer or server as preemptive.

is-burst.description: Enable/disable the server and send a burst of packets when the server is reachable.

is-iburst.description: Enable/disable the server and send a burst of packets when the server is unreachable.

ifname.description: Name of an interface.

key-id.description: Key ID used to transmit messages to broadcast clients.

ifname.description: Name of an interface.

ip-address.description: The IP address must be a multicast address and cannot be the loopback, broadcast, host, or reference clock address.

ttl-value.description: Life span of a multicast packet.

version.description: NTP version that needs to be set in NTP packets while multicasting.

key-id.description: Key ID used to transmit messages to multicast clients.

ifname.description: Name of an interface.

ip-address.description: The IP address must be a multicast address and cannot be the loopback, broadcast, host, or reference clock address.

ttl-value.description: Life span of a manycast packet.

key-id.description: Key ID used to transmit messages to a manycast group. If a key-id is specified, the number ranges from 1 to 65535.
Specifies the key number used when transmitting messages to the remote peer.

key-value.description: Authentication password, the password is a string ranging from 1 to 255 characters for a plaintext password and 20 to 432 characters for a ciphertext password.

is-reliable.description: Enable/disable key reliability. A client can be synchronized only with the server that provides a reliable key.

is-auth-password-check.description: Enable/disable password strength check on identity authentication.

is-kod-enable.description: Enable/disable Kiss-o'-Death feature and sending of KISS codes.

min-discard-intval.description: Specifies the minimum packet sending interval. If the actual packet sending interval is smaller than the value, packets are discarded. The units is second as power of 2.

avg-discard-intval.description: Average interval at which packets are sent. The units is second as power of 2.

acl4-identity.description: Number or name of a basic access control list (ACL). If an ACL number is specified, the number ranges from 2000 to 2999. If an ACL name is specified, the name must start with a letter or a digital, spaces not supported, and can not be a number.

acl6-identity.description: ACL6 number or name. If an ACL6 number is specified, the number ranges from 2000 to 2999. If an ACL6 name is specified, the name must start with a letter or a digital, spaces not supported, and can not be a number.

clocks.description: List of NTP master clock configurations.

clock.description: Configure List of NTP master clock.

local-addr.description: IP address of the local clock. The IP address must be a local host address and cannot be the loopback, broadcast, host, multicast.

stratum.description: Stratum of the NTP master clock. The smaller the value is, the more accurate the clock is.

in-interface-disables.description: List of interfaces that prohibit the receiving of NTP messages.

in-interface-disable.description: Configure the receiving of NTP messages on a specified interface prohibited.

ifname.description: Specifies the name of the interface that prohibits the receiving of NTP messages.

source-interface.description: Configure the NTP source interface. In broadcast and multicast modes, this parameter does not need to be configured because the NTP service is implemented on the source interface.

ifname.description: Specifies the local interface used for sending and receiving NTP packets.

server-source-interfaces.description: List of NTP server source interfaces.

server-source-interface.description: Configure the NTP server source interface for listening.

ifname.description: Server source interface name.

server-isolate-source-interfaces.description: List of the isolate source interface and source address.

server-isolate-source-interface.description: Configure the isolate source interface and source address.

ifname.description: Specify the isolate source interface name.

ipv4-addr.description: Specify the isolate source IPv4 address. The IP address must be a host address and cannot be the loopback, broadcast, multicast, or reference clock address.

server-source-ipv6-addresses.description: List of NTP server source IPv6 addresses.

server-source-ipv6-address.description: Configure the NTP server source IPv6 address for listening.

server-isolate-source-ipv6-interfaces.description: List of the IPv6 isolate source interface and source address.

server-isolate-source-ipv6-interface.description: Configure the IPv6 isolate source interface and source address.

ifname.description: Specify the isolate source interface name.

ipv6-addr.description: Specify the isolate source IPv6 address. The IP address must be a host address and cannot be the loopback, broadcast, multicast, or reference clock address.

server-source-all-interfaces.description: List of configuration which enable the NTP server to listen to all interfaces.

server-source-all-interface.description: Configure the NTP server listen to all interfaces.

addr-family.description: IP address family type of the interface.

server-enables.description: List of NTP server to be enabled.

server-enable.description: Configure the NTP server. The 'get' operation is performed to query the enabling status of the NTP server. The 'create' and 'merge' operations are performed to enable the NTP server. The 'delete' operation is performed to disable the NTP server.

stratum.description: Stratum of the local system clock. If the clock status is unsynchronized, the stratum value is 16.

source.description:
ID of the reference clock.
If the local system clock has been synchronized with a remote NTP server or a reference clock, the ID of the remote NTP server or reference clock is displayed.
If the local system clock acts as a reference clock, 'LOCAL(0)' is displayed.
If the clock status is Unsynchronized, 'none' is displayed.

precision.description: Precision of the local system clock.

offset.description: Offset between the local system clock and the NTP server.

nominal-frequence.description: Nominal frequency of the local system clock.

actual-frequence.description: Actual frequency of the local system clock.

root-delay.description: Total delay between the local system clock and the master reference clock.

root-dispersion.description: Total dispersion between the local system clock and the master reference clock.

peer-dispersion.description: Dispersion between the local system clock and the remote NTP peer.

reference-time.description: Reference timestamp when the local system clock was adjusted last time.

configured.description: Whether the NTP server has been configured.

poll.description: Interval at which the board sends packets to its synchronization source.

reference-time.description: Latest synchronization time of the clock.

full-session.description: Statistics of NTP full session configuration.

source.description: IP address of the reference clock.

ifname.description: Peer interface.

reference-source.description: IP address of the remote server or the identifier of the reference clock that the peer system clock has been synchronized with. If the server belongs to a VPN, this field also shows the name of the VPN.

offset.description: Offset between the local system clock and the peer for the last received packet.

delay.description: Delay between the local system clock and the peer for the last received packet.

dispersion.description: Dispersion between the local system clock and the peer for the last received packet.

root-delay.description: Total delay between the local system clock and the master reference clock.

root-dispersion.description: Total dispersion between the local system clock and the master reference clock.

distance.description: Synchronization distance relative to the reference clock source. NTP selects the clock source with the minimum synchronization distance.

reference-time.description: Reference timestamp when the local system clock is adjusted last time.

origin-time.description: Time when the latest packet was sent from the peer.

receive-time.description: Time when the latest packet was received at the local end.

xmit-time.description: Time when the latest packet was sent to the peer.

filter-delay.description: Filter delay of the latest eight packets received.

filter-offset.description: Filter offset of the latest eight packets received.

filter-dispersion.description: Filter dispersion of the latest eight packets received.

flags.description: Status flags information of the peer.

when.description: Specifies the interval for time synchronization.

disable.description: Configure the NTP service. The 'get' operation is performed to query the disabling status of the NTP service. The 'create' and 'merge' operations are performed to disable the NTP service. The 'delete' operation is performed to enable the NTP service.

is-burst.description: Enable/disable the server and send a burst of packets when the server is reachable.
